identified-content.object.title: Clerks (Tv Program)

abstract.p: ABC's new animated series Clerks, based on 1994 film by Kevin Smith, is set in Leonardo, NJ (S)

block.p: Paterson has Allen Ginsberg. Asbury Park has Bruce Springsteen. And Leonardo has Dante and Randal, the motivation-deprived title characters of ABC's new animated series ''Clerks.''

The show, based on the 1994 black-and-white film directed by Kevin Smith, is set in a cartoon Leonardo, complete with an evil billionaire (voiced by Alec Baldwin) who opens a Disneyesque superstore across from the modest convenience store and video stop staffed by Dante and Randal (voiced by Brian O'Halloran and Jeff Anderson, reprising their film roles).
Paterson has Allen Ginsberg. Asbury Park has Bruce Springsteen. And Leonardo has Dante and Randal, the motivation-deprived title characters of ABC's new animated series ''Clerks.''

The show, based on the 1994 black-and-white film directed by Kevin Smith, is set in a cartoon Leonardo, complete with an evil billionaire (voiced by Alec Baldwin) who opens a Disneyesque superstore across from the modest convenience store and video stop staffed by Dante and Randal (voiced by Brian O'Halloran and Jeff Anderson, reprising their film roles).

In this Leonardo, N.B.A. stars serve on juries and Patrick Swayze runs a pet store. But Dante and Randal aren't swamped by the town's more fanciful aspects; they persevere at their own pace. Think of them as born to plod.
Look out, ''Sopranos.'' Television's clerks are on your turf. The series, which premiered last week, is scheduled to run Wednesday nights at 9:30.
